subject: Re: JUnit 3.8.1, JDK 1.4.1 and RedHat 8.0 -> TextRunnerTest failure
msgSnippet: ... OK.  I m using RedHat 9.0, JUnit 3.8.1 and JDK 1.4.1_01. Everything works fine.  junit.samples.AllTests as well as junit.tests.AllTests... in textui,
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "texanworker" <texanworker@a...> wrote:
> Using RedHat 8.0, JUnit 3.8.1, and JDK 1.4.1_01 I tried to
> run the textui and found
> that it could not run anything.

OK. I'm using RedHat 9.0, JUnit 3.8.1 and JDK 1.4.1_01.

Everything works fine. junit.samples.AllTests as well as
junit.tests.AllTests... in textui, swingui, and Eclipse plugin.

I do notice that in your cmd line examples you don't specify a
classpath. I built sat in the junit bin directory (i.e. where the
class file tree is rooted and used cmd lines such as:

java -classpath . junit.textui.TestRunner junit.tests.AllTests

I never used RedHat 8.0, I leapfrogged from 7.2 to 9.0

Dave
